Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater with turn of rim; interior glazed black with reserved band; exterior: reserved band at junction with rim (sharply carinated step); below, red-figure decoration consisting of hair and hand with pair of spears of seated male; at right, hand of standing figure holding spear; relief-contour for spear-heads.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0198) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 45, pl. L, no. 17)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
